title: Adrian Fenty
summary: Adrian Malik Fenty (born December 6, 1970)[3] is an American politician who served as the sixth mayor of the District of Columbia.[4] He served one term, from 2007 to 2011, losing his bid for reelection at the primary level to Democrat Vincent C. Gray. Though Fenty won the Republican mayoral primary as a write-in candidate, he declined the Republican nomination and said he would likely not seek elected office again. Gray went on to win the general election for Mayor in the largely Democratic District.
